title: Contributors to hubverse repositories
text:
Contributors to hubverse repositories
These are the contributors to hubverse repositories in random order.
 - (mmkerr).
Repositories contributed to: hubDocs.

 - Zhian N. Kamvar (zkamvar). Research Software Engineer | Interested in education, pop genetics, evolution, bioinformatics, and R programming. Beaverton, OR.
Repositories contributed to: hubDocs, hubExamples, hubverse-cloud, hubEnsembles, hubverse-actions, hubEnsemblesManuscript, schemas, hubverse, hubValidations, hubVis, hubCI, hubverse-infrastructure, hubData, hubverse-developer-actions, hubDevs, example-complex-forecast-hub, hubUtils, hub-dashboard-predtimechart, hubEvals, hubTemplate, hubAdmin, example-simple-forecast-hub, hubverse-org.r-universe.dev.

 - Evan Ray (elray1). Research Assistant Professor.
Repositories contributed to: example-complex-scenario-hub, hubEnsemblesManuscript, hubCI, hubverse-infrastructure, hub-dashboard-predtimechart, schemas, hubEvals, hubDocs, hubTemplate, hubValidations, hubExamples, example-simple-forecast-hub, hubEnsembles, example-complex-forecast-hub, hubverse-actions.

 - Li Shandross (lshandross).
Repositories contributed to: hubEnsemblesManuscript, hubData, hubDocs, hubverse, hubExamples, hubEnsembles, hubUtils.

 - Alvaro J. Castro Rivadeneira (micokoch). Ecuagringo🇪🇨🇺🇸 Epidemiology PhD student. Amherst, MA.
Repositories contributed to: example-complex-scenario-hub, hubData, schemas, hubDocs, hubverse, hubTemplate, example-simple-forecast-hub, example-complex-forecast-hub.

 - Koji SATO (kjsato).
Repositories contributed to: schemas, hubDocs.

 - Nikos Bosse (nikosbosse). PhD student in Epidemiology, working at Metaculus. London.
Repositories contributed to: hubEvals.

 - Sebastian Funk (sbfnk). London.
Repositories contributed to: hubEnsemblesManuscript.

 - Becky Sweger (bsweger). research fellow and software engineer, Biostatistics and Epidemiology at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. Easthampton, MA.
Repositories contributed to: hubDocs, hubExamples, hubverse-cloud, hubEnsembles, hubverse-actions, schemas, hubverse, hubValidations, hubCI, hubverse-infrastructure, flusight_hub_archive, hubData, hubverse-developer-actions, hubDevs, example-complex-forecast-hub, hubUtils, hubEvals, hubTemplate, hubAdmin, hubverse-transform.

 - Dylan H. Morris (dylanhmorris). Team Lead, Center for Forecasting and Outbreak Analytics, @CDCGov. Account is a mix of personal and professional code..
Repositories contributed to: hubTemplate.

 - Shaun Truelove (shauntruelove).
Repositories contributed to: example-complex-scenario-hub.

 - Lucie Contamin (LucieContamin). Pittsburgh.
Repositories contributed to: example-complex-scenario-hub, hubEnsemblesManuscript, hubDocs, hubValidations, hubTemplate, hubExamples, example-simple-forecast-hub, hubVis.

 - Harry Hochheiser (harryhoch). Professor, Biomedical Informatics, University of Pittsburgh. @deepphe, @bd2kccd, @dbmi-pitt, @nlpreviz see also https://gitlab.com/harryhoch. Pittsburgh, PA.
Repositories contributed to: hubVis, hubEnsemblesManuscript, hubDocs.

 - Kath Sherratt (kathsherratt). I’m a researcher at LSHTM with the @epiforecasts team.. London.
Repositories contributed to: example-simple-forecast-hub, example-complex-scenario-hub.

 - Hugo Gruson (Bisaloo). Lead Software Architect @ data.org.
Repositories contributed to: hubEnsembles, hubEnsemblesManuscript.

 - (mzorn-58).
Repositories contributed to: hubTemplate, hubDocs, .github.

 - Matthew Cornell (matthewcornell). Amherst, mA.
Repositories contributed to: hubverse-transform, hub-dashboard-predtimechart, hubData, hubverse-infrastructure.

 - Anna Krystalli (annakrystalli). Research Software Engineering Service in #rstats at @r-rse. Ex @RSE-Sheffield. Editor @ropensci. Core team member @reprohack. Available for hire! 🚀😎. Syros, Greece.
Repositories contributed to: hubDocs, hubExamples, hubverse-cloud, hubEnsembles, hubverse-actions, .github, example-simple-forecast-hub, example-complex-scenario-hub, hubEnsemblesManuscript, ci-testhub-simple, schemas, hubverse, hubValidations, hubVis, hubCI, hubverse-infrastructure, hubData, hubverse-developer-actions, hubDevs, ci-testhub-simple-old-orgname, example-complex-forecast-hub, hubUtils, hubEvals, hubTemplate, hubAdmin, hubStyle.

 - Nicholas G Reich (nickreich).
Repositories contributed to: hubEnsemblesManuscript, hubverse-infrastructure, flusight_hub_archive, hubData, schemas, hubEvals, hubDocs, hubverse, hubTemplate, hubValidations, hubExamples, example-simple-forecast-hub, hubVis, hubEnsembles, example-complex-forecast-hub, hubUtils.

 - Emily Howerton (eahowerton).
Repositories contributed to: hubEnsemblesManuscript, hubEnsembles, example-complex-forecast-hub.

 - Luke C Mullany (lmullany). Public Health Scientist / Epidemiologist / Biostatistician.
Repositories contributed to: flusight_hub_archive.

title: Consulting Support
text: All Hubverse tools, packages, and documentation on this website are available open source to anyone looking to use them. However, setting up and maintaining a hub can be complicated and time-consuming, and we therefore recognize the desire that some users may have for additional tailored support. For this reason, we also offer consulting services that can provide additional assistance with tooling and tool development, hub set-up, and ongoing hub maintenance. Hubverse software consulting services can be written into grant proposals or directly contracted through the Biostatistics Consulting Center at UMass Amherst. Initial consultations and discussions about the Hubverse are free of charge, and we are always happy to discuss whether using the Hubverse for your project would be a good fit and help you get launched!

title: Consulting Support
text:
Menu of services






Hourly hub consulting



One-off discussions about use of tooling or additional tool development
- $150 per hour








Set-up of a real-time hub



Includes initial consultation meetings, repository set-up, creation of configuration files, dashboard set-up
- One-time $6000 fee








Hub maintenance



May include all or any combination of the following: troubleshooting validations, communication with modeling teams, dashboard maintenance, merging in pull requests, running baseline/ensemble models
- Monthly $3000-$6000, calculated as $150 per hour x 20-40 person hours a month, negotiable
- Weekly $750-$1500, calculated as $150 per hour x 5-10 person hours a week, negotiable
- Or hourly at $150 per hour


If interested, please contact hubverse+help@groups.io. In your message, please provide a brief description of the hub, a link to the repository (if applicable), and what you hope to address with the consulting session.

title: Submit Model Output
text:
Submit your model

use hubValidations::submission_tmpl() to create a model output submission template.
fork the repository
upload your model submission into the model-output/YOUR-ORG_MODEL/ folder
party down

title: Submit Model Output
text:
important packages
As a modeler, you will find the following packages important:

hubData seamlessly access data from a local or remote hub
hubValidations create submisson template and validate your model.

title: Data Standards
text:
Tip



We have a tool suite that is designed to work with data from any hub.
The core of the hubverse lies within the data standards that define the structure of model submission files.
These standards are encoded in versioned JSON schemas.
The current version is v5.0.0

title: Data Standards
text: Tasks

title: Data Standards
text: Admin

title: Software
text:
Tip



Thanks to rigorous data standards, our software works on any hub.

title: Software
text:
R packages





flowchart TD
  subgraph core
  hubUtils
  end

  subgraph validation
  hubValidations
  hubAdmin
  end

  subgraph data access
  hubData
  zoltr
  end

  hubValidations --> hubUtils
  hubValidations --> hubData
  hubValidations --> hubAdmin
  hubAdmin --> hubUtils
  hubData --> hubUtils
  hubData --> zoltr

  subgraph model-evaluation
  hubEnsembles --> hubUtils
  hubVis --> hubUtils
  hubEvals --> hubUtils
  end

title: The Hubverse
text:
community  Data Standards  Software
Use the hubverse data standards and software to:

 Collaborate with modelers around the world
 Share insights in real time
 Inform critical decisions with robust and validated model outputs


Would you like to know more?

title: The Hubverse
text:
community  Data Standards  Software
Use the hubverse data standards and software to:

 Collaborate with modelers around the world
 Share insights in real time
 Inform critical decisions with robust and validated model outputs


Would you like to know more?

title: The Hubverse
text:
Data Standards
The core of the hubverse are the robust and flexible data standards that allow administrators to write structured guidelines for model output submissions that can be easily validated.

title: The Hubverse
text:
Software
Hubverse software is written in R and provides tools for all phases in the life cycle of a hub.

 set up and manage a hub with hubAdmin
 validate model submissions with hubValidations
 fetch model and target data with hubData
 ensemble models with hubEnsembles
 evaluate model performance with hubEvals
 visualize forecasts with hubViz
… and more!

All of these packages are available at The Hubverse R-Universe

title: The Hubverse

Organizations using the hubverse

   Reich Lab (UMass)

   MIDAS network


   
   Johns Hopkins University Infectious Disease Dynamics Group


   
   AI4Casting (U of Guelph)

title: What is a Modeling Hub?
text:
A collaborative modeling hub is a centralized data portal for modeling challenges. The structured data standards combined with robust hubverse software facilitate rapid validation of model submissions.
The robust and validated data feed downstream analyses, reports, and dashboards that provide visualizations and evaluations to support modelers and decision makers.





flowchart LR
    subgraph validation
    modelA --> hub((modeling hub))
    modelB --> hub((modeling hub))
    modelC --> hub((modeling hub))
    hub
    end
    data[(model output data)]
    hub --> data
    subgraph dashboards
    data --> evaluation
    data --> visualization
    data --> reports
    end
    reports --> decisions{decisions}
    visualization --> decisions
    evaluation --> decisions

title: Create a Hub
text:
You need to answer a few questions first:

What are the quantities you want to forecast? your modeling targets
What variables do you want to use for modeling?
What is the forecasting horizon (if any)?
What kind of estimates do you expect to represent the value of the modeling target (e.g. quantile and mean values)? These are output types.
How often do you want to take submissions? your modeling rounds

By answering these questions, you will be able to determine your modeling tasks. A modeling task focuses on a single target and is made up of a unique combination of variables used for modeling and the output types. These variables are collectively known as task IDs.

title: Create a Hub
text:
You need to answer a few questions first:

What are the quantities you want to forecast? your modeling targets
What variables do you want to use for modeling?
What is the forecasting horizon (if any)?
What kind of estimates do you expect to represent the value of the modeling target (e.g. quantile and mean values)? These are output types.
How often do you want to take submissions? your modeling rounds

By answering these questions, you will be able to determine your modeling tasks. A modeling task focuses on a single target and is made up of a unique combination of variables used for modeling and the output types. These variables are collectively known as task IDs.

title: Create a Hub
text:
Create your hub
Follow the steps outlined in https://hubverse.io/en/latest/quickstart-hub-admin/intro.html to set up your very first hub.

title: Create a Hub
text:
important packages
As an administrator, you might want to use these tools to help you administer your hub.

hubAdmin provides tools for you to create a new hub
hubCI allows you to set up automated check for your hub on github

title: Analyze Data
text:
When analysing data from a hub, you will want the following packages:

hubData seamlessly access data from a local or remote hub
hubEnsembles combine models into an ensemble using built-in or custom methods
hubVis visualize model output
hubEvals compare and evaluate models in an established hub

title: Analyze Data
text:
When analysing data from a hub, you will want the following packages:

hubData seamlessly access data from a local or remote hub
hubEnsembles combine models into an ensemble using built-in or custom methods
hubVis visualize model output
hubEvals compare and evaluate models in an established hub

title: Active Hubs
text:
US Centers for Disease Control
    
    
    
        
            
                
                FluSight Forecast Hub
                
                
                    This project collects forecasts for weekly new hospitalizations due to confirmed influenza.
                
                
                    Licensed under the MIT License
                    
                    Contact: flusight@cdc.gov
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    FluSight Forecast Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    FluSight Forecast Hub Forecasts
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    FluSight Forecast Hub Evaluations
                    
                    
                
            
            
                 s3://cdcepi-flusight-forecast-hub 
            
        
        
            
                
                COVID-19 Forecast Hub
                
                
                    A repository run by the US CDC to collect forecasts of weekly incident COVID-19 hospital admissions.
                
                
                    Licensed under the Apache License 2.0
                    
                    Contact: covidhub@cdc.gov
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    COVID-19 Forecast Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    COVID-19 Forecast Hub Forecasts
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    COVID-19 Forecast Hub Evaluations
                    
                    
                
            
            
                 s3://covid19-forecast-hub 
            
        
    


    
      
      European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC)
    
    
    
        
            
                
                RespiCast Syndromic Indicators
                
                
                    The European Syndromic Indicators Forecasting Hub collates weekly forecasts on Influenza-Like-Illness (ILI) and Acute Respiratory Infection (ARI) incidence in EU/EEA countries.
                
                
                    
                    Contact: european.modelling.hub@ecdc.europa.eu
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    RespiCast Syndromic Indicators Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    RespiCast Syndromic Indicators Forecasts
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    RespiCast Syndromic Indicators Evaluations
                    
                    
                
            
        
        
            
                
                European Covid-19 Forecasting Hub
                
                
                    The European Covid-19 Forecasting Hub collates weekly forecasts on Covid-19 Hospital Admissions in EU/EEA countries.
                
                
                    
                    Contact: european.modelling.hub@ecdc.europa.eu
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    European Covid-19 Forecasting Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    European Covid-19 Forecasting Hub Forecasts
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    European Covid-19 Forecasting Hub Evaluations
                    
                    
                
            
        
        
            
                
                RespiCompass - ECDC’s Respiratory Diseases Scenario Hub
                
                
                    RespiCompass is a platform dedicated to hosting and sharing scenario modelling results for respiratory pathogens. This initiative is funded and led by the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC). RespiCompass develops and applies multi-model analyses through international modelling collaboration.
                
                
                    
                    Contact: european.modelling.hub@ecdc.europa.eu
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    RespiCompass - ECDC’s Respiratory Diseases Scenario Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    RespiCompass - ECDC’s Respiratory Diseases Scenario Hub Insights
                    
                    
                
            
        
    


    
      
      Reich Lab (UMass)
    
    
    
        
            
                
                Variant Nowcast Hub
                
                
                    A repository to store COVID-19 variant nowcasts collected as a modeling hub.
                
                
                    Licensed under the MIT License
                    
                    Contact: nick@umass.edu
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    Variant Nowcast Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    Variant Nowcast Hub Insights
                    
                    
                
            
            
                 s3://variant-nowcast-hub 
            
        
        
            
                
                Flu Metrocast Hub
                
                
                    The Flu MetroCast Hub is a modeling hub with the goal of collecting city- and county-level forecasts of influenza activity. The hub is led by the epiENGAGE team from UT-Austin and UMass-Amherst, as a part of the CDC Insight Net program.
                
                
                    Licensed under the MIT License
                    
                    Contact: donga0223@gmail.com
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    Flu Metrocast Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    Flu Metrocast Hub Forecasts
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    Flu Metrocast Hub Evaluations
                    
                    
                
            
            
                 s3://reichlab-flu-metrocast-hub 
            
        
    


    
      
      California Department of Public Health
    
    
    
        
            
                
                West Nile Virus Forecasting Hub
                
                
                    This is an open (by request) forecasting challenge to predict monthly West Nile virus (WNV) total disease cases in select California counties in 2024 in the months of May through December. This is the first iteration of a California county-specific Forecasting Challenge.
                
                
                    Licensed under the CC-BY 4.0 license
                    
                    Contact: modeling@cdph.ca.gov
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    West Nile Virus Forecasting Hub Hub
                    
                    
                
            
        
    


    
      
      MIDAS network
    
    
    
        
            
                
                RSV Scenario Modeling Hub
                
                
                    The goal of this RSV round is to expand on RSV modeling capabilities developed last year by the Scenario Modeling Hub to generate ensemble projections of RSV hospitalizations for the 2024-25 season under different intervention scenarios.
                
                
                    Licensed under the MIT License
                    
                    Contact: scenariohub@midasnetwork.u
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    RSV Scenario Modeling Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    RSV Scenario Modeling Hub Insights
                    
                    
                
            
        
        
            
                
                Flu Scenario Modeling Hub
                
                
                    A major output of the projection hub is ensemble estimates of epidemic outcomes (e.g., infection, hospitalizations, and deaths), for different time points, intervention scenarios, and US jurisdictions.
                
                
                    Licensed under the MIT License
                    
                    Contact: scenariohub@midasnetwork.u
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    Flu Scenario Modeling Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    Flu Scenario Modeling Hub Insights
                    
                    
                
            
        
    


    
      
      Johns Hopkins University Infectious Disease Dynamics Group
    
    
    
        
            
                
                US RSV Forecast Hub
                
                
                    This repository is designed to collect forecast data for the 2024-2025 RSV Forecast Hub run by Johns Hopkins University Infectious Disease Dynamics Group. This project collects forecasts for weekly new hospitalizations due to confirmed RSV.
                
                
                    Licensed under the MIT License
                    
                    Contact: shauntruelove@jhu.edu
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    US RSV Forecast Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    US RSV Forecast Hub Forecasts
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    US RSV Forecast Hub Evaluations
                    
                    
                
            
        
    


    
      
      AI4Casting (U of Guelph)
    
    
    
        
            
                
                Hosptitalization Forecast Hub
                
                
                    Public Health Ontario’s Ontario Respiratory Virus Tool Data monitors the capacity of hospitals, helping policymakers and health professionals gauge the burden of disease on the healthcare system. It tracks real-time bed utilization, enabling effective planning for resource allocation, particularly during times of heightened disease outbreaks.
                
                
                    Licensed under the MIT License
                    
                    Contact: skadam@uoguelph.ca
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    Hosptitalization Forecast Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    Hosptitalization Forecast Hub Forecasts
                    
                    
                
            
        
        
            
                
                RVDSS Forecast Hub
                
                
                    RVDSS is a national surveillance system that collects and reports data on the detection of respiratory viruses, including RSV (Respiratory Syncytial Virus), SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19), and Influenza. Through laboratory-confirmed positive tests, the system helps track the spread of these viruses, offering essential data to support public health measures, pandemic preparedness, and disease control.
                
                
                    Licensed under the MIT License
                    
                    Contact: skadam@uoguelph.ca
                
                
                    
                    
                    
                    RVDSS Forecast Hub Hub
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    RVDSS Forecast Hub Forecasts
